The first player who runs out of cards wins the game!

Contents: 55 cards

-description from designer

Name: Inn & Stable Owners (fan expansion to Carcassonne)
Description:
Inn and Stable owners of Carcassonne are fed up with the thieves getting all the points by owning the road.

In this Expansion the different features on the Carcassonne tiles can be used to get points even if you do not own the road.

A new way to score the Inns and the Stables.

Name: Escape game: Winter is Coming
Description:
During a strategic and diplomatic meeting between the delegations of each opposing power in Westeros (the King in the North and the Mother of Dragons), the castle is attacked by the White Walkers. Your time is running out as the ice boulder blocking the room entrance is is gradually melting.

A secret passage out of the room is hidden somewhere, will you find it in time? Will you put your political disagreements aside and work with your enemies in order to have better chances at survival? Live the moment as if it were your last, because if you can't fend off the White Walkers in 1 hour, you may well become one ...

This escape game can be played in two teams or as one collaborative group. One player needs to be Game Master and hide riddles and clues in two IRL rooms.

Contents:

1 organizer booklet containing explanations of setting up the game, pledges and answers

2 "mission" sheets with the summary of the rules of the game

41 puzzle cards and tips

10 special "Characters", "Bonus" and "Malus" cards

24 envelopes to hide

Name: Hvor er den lille kanin
Description:
A play-based game for children age 18 months and up.

In this game, an adult player hides a fluffy bunny under one of the six cups, and the child's task is then to find the bunny.

The game has eight suggested play modes, depending on the child's age and development.

Name: Shadow Kingdoms of Valeria: Rise of Titans
Description:
The Story of Rise of Titans: 
Lord Nore, the Lich King, has sacrificed his essence in order to become the Shrine of the Titans, allowing Wardens to resurrect their strongest warriors. As the Shrine magically snapped into existence, it also unearthed ancient spells that will help you turn the tide of battle or manipulate your status within the war. The listless Wraiths have finally awoken from their slumber and now crave retribution for the many wrongs done to monster-kin throughout the ages. Now is the time to send your hordes to great battles and crush the Humans, Elves, and Dwarves from Valeria that have taken your lands. With these new powers at your disposal, will you be able to reclaim your glory and become the next General of the Dark Army?

Introduction: This expansion includes four modules: Shrine of the Titans, Great Battles, Ancient Spells, and Wraith Dice. You may play with one or more modules, mixing and matching as you please. Modules can all be included in a game of Shadow Kingdoms of Valeria, though we recommend that you have a firm understanding of the base game and each module before including them all at once.

-description from publisher

Name: Birdsong
Description:
Birdsong is a Roll-and-Write game that immerses you into a role of a birder in a specific location spending a week spotting, listening to, writing about, and photographing birds unique to that area.

THEME
Travel to Glacier Bay, Alaska in search of Puffins.
Or head down to Big Bend, Texas to snap a prize photo of a Painted Bunting.
Maybe you just want to take your equipment and a taxi down to Central Park to listen to starlings as they return, heralding a new season.
You can also choose to search for ibis and spoonbills in Florida's Everglades.
Two of the international birding locations are the Galapagos Islands and New Zealand.

Each location sheet is different and has birds native to the area. Each individual bird is a scientific illustration, beautifully painted -- The game sheets themselves can even double as birding checklists for the specific locations.

MECHANICS
Birdsong has four different play modes:
Competitive 
Solitaire
Cooperative
Team v Team

In competitive play, players colored draft dice one at a time to allocate to three different areas of their unique player board (bird spotting, preparation, and research). Some areas require a specific color. Others require a number, and some might just require any die of any color. In this mode it's important to see what dice are beneficial to your opponents as well as to yourself. After each player has allocated 18 dice, the game ends and points are tallied from the different sections to determine the winner.

In solitaire play, the player allocates a die and then the next most valuable die disappears. Their task is to gather as many points as possible in 6 3-die rounds.

In cooperative play, everybody is working together to score as many points as possible for the lowest scoring player. In this mode, players will collaborate and give up dice to other players to keep the scoring gap small.

Team v Team play is a variant of cooperative with the exception the players can give/trade dice with their teammates in order to keep the gap small. Everybody on the player with the lowest score at the end of the game loses.

-description from designer

Name: Anno Domini 1666: Veterans of the Tercios – Hidalgos Commoners Set
Description:
Hidalgos are an impoverished Spanish nobles. Often all their worldly possessions comprise a patchwork jacket, a rapier by their side and sometimes an old pistol. An old hat and a cloak are their shelter. Their faces are scarred, mostly because of drunken brawls rather than great battles but don't underestimate them - they use weapons with deadly efficiency.

Impoverished Spanish nobles.

3 plastic miniatures 
6 Character cards including three cards exclusive for this expansion: 2 x Hidalgo Veteran & Cabo
6 item cards

-description from publisher's website

Name: 1-2-3 Cheese!
Description:
Summary:

In 1-2-3 Cheese, players are a brilliant group of mice caught in a cheese heist. To escape, players must try to drop their cheese in other players’ stashes as quickly as possible. Are you one of the amateurs who always tries to drop one cheese at a time? Or, are you the profound mastermind who dares to cheese others three or more cards in a shot? After three rounds of tossing and gobbling, the player who has the most escape points wins the game. Are you ready to cheese?

Goal:

The goal is to have as few cards as possible. During the round, play cards to other players' stashes by either playing multiple cards of the same number or a run of three or more cards. The round ends when a player is out of cards. Players  receive escape points based on the number of cards in their hand and stash. After three rounds, the player with the most points wins the game. In case of a tie, the tied players share the win.

—description from the designer

Name: Real Life
Description:
Accumulate trauma and debt as you try to make it to old age in this dark parody board game. Start with an emotional flaw and an arbitrary amount of debt. Decide whether or not you believe in free will.

Players take turns rolling dice to move their way through the board. Spaces you land on require you to: pay rent, get into a traumatic situation, find a partner, have them break up with you, trigger a world event that hurts everyone in the game, so on and so forth.

Use jobs to help your fellow teammates along their way. 
Take therapy at an absurd price to keep your growing trauma in check or your character commits suicide. But don't land on the black space, or else.

The game ends when all players are dead. If you make it to the end of the board and old age, congratulations! You win or something. You're still dead though.

—description from the designer

Name: Paris
Description:
Quiz game about Paris landmarks.

The board is a map of the city, with a track wandering through it. If a player is the first to land on one of the numbered spaces, he draws the card from the deck of 30 cards and reads out the information on the pink side of the card. Then he turns the card over to see what instructions he has to follow. This are fairly predictable; Miss a turn perhaps, roll the die and move backwards, and so on. The player then takes the card and keeps it in front of him where all the players can see it. The card will have a value ranging from 5 to 30, with the value being commensurate with the penalty value of the instruction on it. If a subsequent player lands on a numbered field that has already been taken, then he treats the space as a normal space without number.

When the numbered space 30 has been reached, that player has finished. The others play on. When all the players have reached the 30 space, the 'won' cards are added up and the winner is the one with the most points.

Name: Lord Of The Drinks: Władca Promili
Description:
You are the one they will tell you about

"His last party was like a Predator meeting with Sauron."

Discover the story of the Promila Ruler.

The time has come to go to the Bottom of the Mortuary, to give the Big Eye the Evil Cookie and take it to the Oven of Destiny - where it will be burned, incinerated, stoned, smoked and thus stop the Big Eye, which wants to cover the world with eternal darkness (yes, it has photophobia). Then there will be great joy ... and every joy should be poured out. In this evil plan, you will be disturbed by the cookie guardian - Bloodthirsty York. But don't worry ... if you fail to deliver the Cake to Piecyek, it may be eternal darkness, but you can always pour your sorrows out of despair.

Simple rules are a way to quickly engage your friends.
The rivalry, twists and turns of the Bloodthirsty York guarantee that you will be happy to come back to the game at subsequent events.
Powerful references to "a certain trilogy" will provide you with an additional, abstract dose of humor.
Everything in addition twice - two boards, two types of gameplay, it's twice as crazy party!

Name: Railroad Ink Challenge: Solo Board
Description:
Challenge yourself with the Solo Board, featuring timed goals to reach before they expire, and research labs that give you the ability to reroll dice if you connect them to your network!

—description from the publisher

A unique board for Railroad Ink specifically designed for solo play.

Name: The Enclave
Description:
The Enclave is an asymmetrical board game of strategy in the conflict between several fantasy factions. This armed conflict is centered around the Human kingdom, which is divided by four opposing sides: The Horde, Iron fist, Forest union and Cult. Each player takes on the role of one of the four sides.

During the game, players develop unique technologies of their faction, conduct research, claim or destroy different objectives on the playing board. They gather armies, build structures and attract neutral units to join their cause. To achieve victory, players must complete military and diplomatic missions, while also pursuing their factions’ unique secret agendas.
